awd_titl_txt: Research Initiation:  Spray Forming Process for Metal-MatrixComposites
awd_abstract_narration: Spray forming process offers a great potential for near-net                shape manufacturing of metal-matrix composites.  A special                      experimental system will be developed to investigate the effects                of process variables such as droplet size, velocity, temperature                history, undercooling and impingement surface condition on the                  formed geometry, microstructure and yield.  Also investigated                   will be the effects of splat phenomena and inclusion of                         reinforcing particulates on the resulting microstructures.                      Several hypothesis on the solidification mechanism will be                      examined, and the results will be incorporated into available                   mathematical processing models.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
